Jaida_Dreyer:
{{Short description|American-Canadian country music singer/songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=February 2018}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jaida Dreyer | image = JaidaDreyerpromo1.jpeg | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Thunder Bay, Ontario]] | origin = [[Latimer, Iowa]]{{cite web|author= |url=http://keanradio.com/jaida-dreyer-releases-new-song-half-broke-horses/ |title=Jaida Dreyer Releases New Song 'Half Broke Horses' |publisher=Keanradio.com |date=January 22, 2013 |accessdate=September 8, 2013}} | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer, songwriter | instrument = Vocals, background vocals, guitar, mandolin | years_active = 2012–present | label = [[Streamsound Records|Streamsound]] | associated_acts = | website = }} '''Jaida Dreyer''' is an American-Canadian [[country music]] singer and songwriter. She was signed as the flagship artist on [[Streamsound Records]], a label founded in 2012 by [[Byron Gallimore]].{{cite web|url=http://www.jaidadreyer.com/about |accessdate=August 30, 2012 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120629161927/http://www.jaidadreyer.com/about |title=About {{!}} Jaida Dreyer |archivedate=June 29, 2012 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2012/02/gallimore-wilkes-launch-streamsound-records/ |title=Gallimore, Wilkes Launch Streamsound Records : MusicRow – Nashville's Music Industry Publication – News, Songs From Music City |publisher=Musicrow.com |date=February 21, 2012 |accessdate=September 8, 2013}} ==Biography== Dreyer debuted in 2012 with the singles "Guy's Girl" and "Confessions", both of which charted on [[Hot Country Songs]]. She also wrote "[[Home Alone Tonight]]" was recorded by country music artist [[Luke Bryan]] as a duet with [[Karen Fairchild]] of [[Little Big Town]] for his fifth studio album, ''[[Kill the Lights (Luke Bryan album)|Kill the Lights]]'' (2015). The song was performed on the [[American Music Awards]] and followed with a multi-week number 1 single.{{cite web |url=http://www.engine145.com/introducing-jaida-dreyer-my-story-is-a-blessing-in-a-blender/ |title=Introducing Jaida Dreyer: "My Story is a Blessing in a Blender" |publisher=Engine 145 |date=April 12, 2010 |accessdate=September 8, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141218104634/http://www.engine145.com/introducing-jaida-dreyer-my-story-is-a-blessing-in-a-blender/ |archive-date=December 18, 2014 |url-status=dead |df=mdy-all }}{{cite web|url=http://www.songlyrics.com/carolyn-dawn-johnson/at-the-time-lyrics/ |title=Carolyn Dawn Johnson - At The Time Lyrics |publisher=Songlyrics.com |date= |accessdate=September 8, 2013}} In early 2013, Deyer released her third single, "Half Broke Horses". Dreyer's debut album, ''I Am Jaida Dreyer'', was released on February 26, 2013.{{cite web |url=http://www.roughstock.com/blog/jaida-dreyer-i-am-jaida-dreyer-tracklist-and-cover-art |title=Jaida Dreyer "I Am Jaida Dreyer" Tracklist And Cover Art | New Country Music, Listen to Songs & Video |publisher=Roughstock.com |accessdate=September 8, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203031634/http://www.roughstock.com/blog/jaida-dreyer-i-am-jaida-dreyer-tracklist-and-cover-art |archive-date=December 3, 2013 |url-status=dead |df=mdy-all }} Dreyer wrote nine songs for the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s television musical drama, ''[[Nashville (2012 TV series)|Nashville]]''. "Dreams" was performed by [[Hayden Panettiere]]'s character Julliette Barnes{{cite web|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2013/11/primetime-nashville-hanky-panky-woman|title=Primetime 'Nashville': "Hanky Panky Woman"|date=November 21, 2013|publisher=|accessdate=November 23, 2018}} and "This Town" performed by [[Clare Bowen]]'s character Scarlett O'Connor.{{cite web|url=http://abc.go.com/music-lounge/blogs/nashville/this-town|title=Watch Music Lounge TV Show - ABC.com|website=ABC|accessdate=November 23, 2018}} She competed as a contestant on the [[USA Network]]'s ''Real Country'' show in 2018, and was crowned the winner of its inaugural season.{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/real-country-winner-jaida-dreyer/|title=Jaida Dreyer Named Season 1 Winner of USA's 'Real Country'|author=Billy Dukes|date=December 12, 2018|publisher=Taste of Country|accessdate=April 20, 2019}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:10em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''I Am Jaida Dreyer'' | * Release date: February 26, 2013 * Label: [[Streamsound Records]] * Formats: CD, music download |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
